conclusion: Use principles of optics related to light refraction to compare refractive indices based on sucrose water concentration.
Refractive index of a substance is related to its concentration, and angles of incidence and refraction are given.
Refractive index n is given by n = c/v, where c is the speed of light in a vacuum and v is the speed of light in the substance.
Since the incident angle θ is the same for both glasses, the ratio of refractive indices β1/β2 will be the same for both glasses.
Given β1 > β2, it follows that n1 > n2.
Since n1 > n2, the concentration of sucrose water in glass A must be greater than in glass B.
Conclude that the concentration of sucrose water in cup A is higher than in cup B.
